Docs.summary: Provides a data-binding handler for a data-bound control at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TextDataBindingHandler> object is a data-binding handler that can provide data to a data-bound text property at design time. Data-binding handlers are used when there is no designer for the control present that would otherwise provide the data for the data bound property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TextDataBindingHandler.DataBindControl%2A> method of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TextDataBindingHandler> sets the `Text` property of the control, if it exists, to a sample data string.
This method should be implemented in a derived class to provide functionality to a custom data-binding handler. The logic for the data-binding should be implemented within this method, and can be specific to the type or types that the handler is binding a property or properties on.

block.para: Most data binding handlers need to examine the data-bindings collection on the control using the interface to determine if any specific properties it can handle are data-bound.
